Let μ\muμ and ν\nuν be two finite positive Borel measures on Rn\R^nRn.

  1. Suppose that there exist Borel sets An⊆XA_n \subseteq XAn​⊆X so that

    lim⁡n→∞μ(An)=0andlim⁡n→∞ν(X∖An)=0.\lim_{n\to\infty} \mu\p{A_n} = 0 \quad\text{and}\quad \lim_{n\to\infty} \nu\p{X \setminus A_n} = 0.n→∞lim​μ(An​)=0andn→∞lim​ν(X∖An​)=0.

    Show that μ\muμ and ν\nuν are mutually singular.

  2. Suppose there are non-negative Borel functions {fn}n\set{f_n}_n{fn​}n​ so that fn(x)>0f_n\p{x} > 0fn​(x)>0 for ν\nuν-a.e. xxx and

    lim⁡n→∞∫fn(x) dμ(x)=0andlim⁡n→∞∫1fn(x) dν(x)=0.\lim_{n\to\infty} \int f_n\p{x} \,\diff\mu\p{x} = 0 \quad\text{and}\quad \lim_{n\to\infty} \int \frac{1}{f_n\p{x}} \,\diff\nu\p{x} = 0.n→∞lim​∫fn​(x)dμ(x)=0andn→∞lim​∫fn​(x)1​dν(x)=0.

    Show that μ\muμ and ν\nuν are mutually singular.
Solution.

  1. Let A=⋃n=1∞⋂k=n∞AkA = \bigcup_{n=1}^\infty \bigcap_{k=n}^\infty A_kA=⋃n=1∞​⋂k=n∞​Ak​, which is Borel as a countable union and countable intersection of Borel sets. By deleting sets if necessary, we may assume without loss of generality that ν(Akc)≤12k\nu\p{A_k^\comp} \leq \frac{1}{2^k}ν(Akc​)≤2k1​. Then

    μ(A)=lim⁡N→∞μ(⋃n=1N⋂k=n∞Ak)≤lim⁡N→∞∑n=1Nμ(⋂k=n∞Ak)=0,\begin{aligned} \mu\p{A} &= \lim_{N\to\infty} \mu\p{\bigcup_{n=1}^N \bigcap_{k=n}^\infty A_k} \\ &\leq \lim_{N\to\infty} \sum_{n=1}^N \mu\p{\bigcap_{k=n}^\infty A_k} \\ &= 0, \end{aligned}μ(A)​=N→∞lim​μ(n=1⋃N​k=n⋂∞​Ak​)≤N→∞lim​n=1∑N​μ(k=n⋂∞​Ak​)=0,​

    since whenever m≥nm \geq nm≥n, we have μ(⋂k=n∞Ak)≤μ(Am)→m→∞0\mu\p{\bigcap_{k=n}^\infty A_k} \leq \mu\p{A_m} \xrightarrow{m\to\infty} 0μ(⋂k=n∞​Ak​)≤μ(Am​)m→∞​0. Similarly,

    ν(Ac)=lim⁡N→∞ν(⋂n=1N⋃k=n∞Akc)=lim⁡N→∞ν(⋃k=N∞Akc)≤lim⁡N→∞∑k=N∞12k=0,\begin{aligned} \nu\p{A^\comp} &= \lim_{N\to\infty} \nu\p{\bigcap_{n=1}^N \bigcup_{k=n}^\infty A_k^\comp} \\ &= \lim_{N\to\infty} \nu\p{\bigcup_{k=N}^\infty A_k^\comp} \\ &\leq \lim_{N\to\infty} \sum_{k=N}^\infty \frac{1}{2^k} \\ &= 0, \end{aligned}ν(Ac)​=N→∞lim​ν(n=1⋂N​k=n⋃∞​Akc​)=N→∞lim​ν(k=N⋃∞​Akc​)≤N→∞lim​k=N∑∞​2k1​=0,​

    since the infinite sum converges. Thus, μ(A)=ν(Ac)=0\mu\p{A} = \nu\p{A^\comp} = 0μ(A)=ν(Ac)=0, so μ⊥ν\mu \perp \nuμ⊥ν.

  2. Since fnf_nfn​ is Borel, the set An={fn>1}={1fn<1}A_n = \set{f_n > 1} = \set{\frac{1}{f_n} < 1}An​={fn​>1}={fn​1​<1} is Borel. Then by Chebyshev's inequality,

    μ(An)≤∫fn dμ→n→∞0ν(Anc)≤∫1fn dν→n→∞0.\begin{aligned} \mu\p{A_n} &\leq \int f_n \,\diff\mu \xrightarrow{n\to\infty} 0 \\ \nu\p{A_n^\comp} &\leq \int \frac{1}{f_n} \,\diff\nu \xrightarrow{n\to\infty} 0. \end{aligned}μ(An​)ν(Anc​)​≤∫fn​dμn→∞​0≤∫fn​1​dνn→∞​0.​

    Thus, by (1), we see that μ⊥ν\mu \perp \nuμ⊥ν, as required.
